q: This organization is responsible for developing and maintaining the Michigan Food Code.
a: "What is the Michigan Department of Agriculture and Rural Development (MDARD)?"

q: These are the two major categories of hazards addressed in the Michigan Food Code.
a: "What are biological hazards and physical hazards?"

q: This term refers to the process of heating food to a specific temperature for a specific amount of time to eliminate or reduce microorganisms.

q: This is the term used to describe a food item that has been exposed to a potential contamination source.

q: This is the term used to describe a written document that outlines the procedures for safely handling food in a food service establishment.

q: This is the term used to describe an incident in which two or more people experience a similar illness after consuming a common food.
This is the government agency responsible for investigating and monitoring foodborne outbreaks in the United States.

q: This is the term used to describe a food product that has been specially formulated or processed to remove or reduce allergenic proteins.

q: This is the term used to describe the number of new cases of a particular disease that occur within a specific population during a defined time period.
